meanings.definition: The lower extremity of the leg below the ankle, on which a person stands or walks.
meanings.sent1: She hurt her foot while playing soccer.
meanings.sent2: He walked barefoot on the sandy beach.
meanings.sent3: The foot of the mountain was covered in lush greenery.
meanings.sent4: The foot of the bed was where the cat liked to nap.
meanings.sent5: The tiny footprints in the snow led to a hidden treasure.

meanings.definition: The base or bottom of something.
meanings.sent1: The foot of the vase was cracked.
meanings.sent2: The foot of the mountain was shrouded in mist.
meanings.sent3: The foot of the stairs creaked loudly with each step.
meanings.sent4: The foot of the page was smudged with ink.
meanings.sent5: The foot of the tree provided shade from the scorching sun.

meanings.definition: A unit of linear measure equal to 12 inches.
meanings.sent1: The table was six feet long.
meanings.sent2: She measured the room in square feet.
meanings.sent3: The carpenter cut the wood into two-foot sections.
meanings.sent4: The fabric was sold by the foot at the store.
meanings.sent5: The garden was adorned with colorful foot-long ribbons.
